hanzi-su-wiki:
頓

Значения

Вдруг, внезапно, сразу же; склонять голову; быстрый

Мнемоника

Земной поклон с касанием головы 頁 выходящих из-под земли ростков 屯.

Варианты

顿
purpleculture_pinyin:
dùn
to stop; to pause; to arrange; to lay out; to kowtow; to stamp (one's foot); at once; classifier for meals, beatings, scoldings etc: time, bout, spell, meal
прекратить; сделать паузу; устроить; выложить; низко поклоняться; топнуть (ногой); однажды; классификатор еды, побоев, выговоров и т. д .: время, схватка, заклинание, еда
rtega_mnemonic:
頓頓RS
顿顿		pause, stop, halt, bow, stamp, arrange, suddenly
  • suddenly bow the head 頁 like a sprout 屯 to arrange things fallen on the floor
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 顿)
Pictophonetic: 屯 indicates the sound; 頁 (head) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples: 頓時 [ dùn shí ]: immediately; suddenly

    • 頁 [ yè ] page, sheet, leaf
heisig_chinese_memo: Ever chopped the head off an earthworm? Notice how it will grow back immediately without pause! Beware the killer earthworms...
heisig_constituent: immediate, earthworm, drop, shovel, fishhook, head, page, one, ceiling, drop, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight
koohiiStory1: Ever chopped the head off an earthworm? Notice how it will grow back immediately! Beware the killer earthworms...
koohiiStory2: When someone in the barracks tells you to come immediately, you´ll lose your head for sure トン トツ にわか.に とん.と つまず.く とみ.に ぬかずく suddenly; immediately; in a hurry.
kunYomi: にわか.に、とん.と、つまず.く、とみ.に、ぬかずく
Ru_Meaning: suddenly, immediately, in a hurry, arrange, stay in place, bow, kowtow
Ru_Radicals: ハ, 屯 (военный лагерь), 目 (глаз), 貝 (раковина), 頁 (страница)
Ru_trainchinese:
dùn: (сч.слово) раз (счетное слово для приемов пищи, замечаний, выговоров, избиений и т.д.)
dùn: (нареч/глаг) вдруг, внезапно; останавливаться; (каллиграфия) останавливаться, задерживая кисть на бумаге
dùn: (графема) уставший; устраивать, размещать; бить в пол (лбом при поклоне); топать
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the page (頁) is in the barracks (屯) suddenly
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: When the earthworm begins to move its head stretches forward to get a grip on the ground while the rest of the body is in a pause.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " page ", " tun " sound, the original meaning is to knock the ground with the first. "Shuowen": "Next to the first. From the page, Tunsheng." "Zhou Li‧ Chunguan‧ Dazhu": "One is Jishou, the other is to pause."

" Ton " can mean stomping the ground with one foot. Southern Song Baozhao "Wuhe Fu": "Introducing Kang's slenderness, and restoring his toes."

" Pause " can also mean percussion and percussion. Jin Wangjia's "Supplementary Notes: Wei": "When Nanyue presented a white elephant in front of the emperor, Zhang (Cao Zhang) stopped his nose with his hands, and the elephant stood still."

" Pause " also means to stop and fall. Han Lujia's "Xinyu‧ Qualifications": "Serve on the mountain of Wei and Cui, and stop at the river of Ming and Ming."

" Pause " also means destruction and decline. "Mandarin-Zhou Yushang": "There is no time to abolish the precepts of the king, but how long does the king take?" Wei Zhao's note: "Pause, defeat."

" Pause " can also mean removal or abandonment. "Selected Works-Cao Zhi's Qiqi": "So the bells rang and the drums were closed, the banners were relaxed, and the nets were suspended, and the squat was stopped and returned." Li Shan's note: "Ten, you still do."

" Pause " also refers to jitter and vibration. Jin Luji "Ying Jiafu": "Looking up to the masses to move away from the distance, and the junyu to whirling."

" Pause " also refers to rectify, pause and make uniform. "The Book of the Later Han Dynasty: The Biography of Ma Rong": "Then raise the sky net, stop eight hunks, grab the nine serval animals, and scavenge the four wilds for the expedition."

Pause and stop are also indicated by " pause ". "Selected Works‧Fu Yi's "Dancing Fu"": "You won't hit the toes without hitting it, and you won't stop your toes if you dance." Li Shan's note: "You won't be able to stop your toes even if you dance a drum."

" Ton " also means lodging and premises. "Song Shu·Xianbei Tuyuhun Biography": "So I hugged the horse and went west, moved a meal every day, and stopped for eighty miles."

" Pause " also means simultaneously, all at once. Jin Zhanghua's "History of Natural History" Volume 10: "A person can soak his knees with cold water, and he can eat dozens of melons."

" Ton " is also used as a quantifier to indicate the number of times. The Southern Song Dynasty Liu Yiqing's "Shi Shuo Xin Yu-Ren Dan": "Wen Qing Temple, I want to beg for a meal."
humanum_short_description_en: From " page ", " tun " sound, the original meaning is to knock the ground with the first.
humanum_full_description:
從「頁」，「屯」聲，本義為以首叩地。《說文》：「下首也。从頁，屯聲。」《周禮‧春官‧大祝》：「一曰稽首，二曰頓首。」

　　「頓」可表示以足跺地。南朝宋鮑照〈舞鶴賦〉：「引員亢之纖婉，頓脩趾之洪姱。」

　　「頓」也可表示叩擊、敲打。晉王嘉《拾遺記‧魏》：「時南越獻白象子在帝前，彰(曹彰)手頓其鼻，象伏不動。」

　　「頓」還表示頓仆、跌倒。漢陸賈《新語‧資質》：「仆於嵬崔之山，頓於窅冥之溪。」

　　「頓」亦表示毀壞、敗落。《國語‧周語上》：「其無及廢先王之訓而王幾頓乎？」韋昭注：「頓，敗也。」

　　「頓」還可表示撤除、捨棄。《文選‧曹植〈七啟〉》：「於是駴鍾鳴鼓，收旌弛旆，頓綱縱網，罷獠回邁。」李善注：「頓，猶捨也。」

　　「頓」也指抖動、振動。晉陸機〈應嘉賦〉：「仰群軌以遙企，頓駿羽以婆娑。」

　　「頓」還指整頓、頓而使齊。《後漢書‧馬融傳》：「然後舉天網，頓八紘，揫歛九藪之動物，繯橐四野之飛征。」

　　停頓、停止也用「頓」表示。《文選‧傅毅〈舞賦〉》：「擊不致筴，蹈不頓趾。」李善注：「蹈鼓而足趾不頓，言輕且疾也。」

　　「頓」還表示宿食之所、館舍。《宋書‧鮮卑吐谷渾傳》：「於是擁馬西行，日移一頓，頓八十里。」

　　「頓」亦表示同時、一下子。晉張華《博物志》卷十：「人以冷水自漬至膝，可頓啖數十枚瓜。」

　　「頓」還用作量詞，表示次數。南朝宋劉義慶《世說新語‧任誕》：「聞卿祠，欲乞一頓食耳。」
humanum_short_description: 從「頁」，「屯」聲，本義為以首叩地。

頓頓RS
顿顿 		pause, stop, halt, bow, stamp, arrange, suddenly
  • suddenly bow the head 頁 like a sprout 屯 to arrange things fallen on the floor
(Simplified: 顿)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 屯 indicates the sound; 頁 (head) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 屯 [ tún ] village, hamlet; camp; station
    • 頁 [ yè ] page, sheet, leaf
①很短時間的停止：停頓。頓宕。抑揚頓挫。
②忽然，立刻，一下子：頓然。頓即。頓悟。茅塞頓開。
③叩，跺：頓首再拜。
④處理，設置：安頓。整頓。
⑤疲乏：困頓。勞頓。
⑥書法上指運筆用力向下而暫不移動：橫的兩頭都要頓一頓。
⑦次：三頓飯。
⑧古同“鈍”，不鋒利。
⑨姓氏。

Southern Song Baozhao "Wuhe Fu": "Introducing Kang's slenderness, and restoring his toes." " Pause" can also mean percussion and percussion. Jin Wangjia's "Supplementary Notes: Wei": "When Nanyue presented a white elephant in front of the emperor, Zhang (Cao Zhang) stopped his nose with his hands, and the elephant stood still." " Pause" also means to stop and fall. Han Lujia's "Xinyu‧ Qualifications": "Serve on the mountain of Wei and Cui, and stop at the river of Ming and Ming." " Pause" also means destruction and decline. "Mandarin-Zhou Yushang": "There is no time to abolish the precepts of the king, but how long does the king take?" Wei Zhao's note: "Pause, defeat." " Pause" can also mean removal or abandonment. "Selected Works-Cao Zhi's Qiqi": "So the bells rang and the drums were closed, the banners were relaxed, and the nets were suspended, and the squat was stopped and returned." Li Shan's note: "Ten, you still do." " Pause" also refers to jitter and vibration. Jin Luji "Ying Jiafu": "Looking up to the masses to move away from the distance, and the junyu to whirling." "The Book of the Later Han Dynasty: The Biography of Ma Rong": "Then raise the sky net, stop eight hunks, grab the nine serval animals, and scavenge the four wilds for the expedition." Li Shan's note: "You won't be able to stop your toes even if you dance a drum." " Ton" also means lodging and premises. "Song Shu·Xianbei Tuyuhun Biography": "So I hugged the horse and went west, moved a meal every day, and stopped for eighty miles." " Pause" also means simultaneously, all at once. 頓字的基本解释

頓
dùn

頓字的汉语字典释义

[①]［dùn］
“顿1”的繁体字。
(1)以首叩地。
(2)指点头动作。
(3)以足跺地。
(4)以物触地；把一物猛地下放而碰撞另一物。
(5)叩击；敲打。
(6)顿仆；跌倒。
(7)从高处往下行。
(8)毁坏；败落。
(9)疲劳，乏力。
(10)撤除；舍弃。
(11)排遣，消除。
(12)抖动；振动。
(13)整顿；顿而使齐。
(14)挣；甩。
(15)停顿，停止。
(16)住宿；驻屯。
(17)留，逗留。亦谓较长时间的居留，滞留。
(18)宿食之所；馆舍。
(19)指宿食所需之物。
(20)放置。
(21)昏乱。
(22)佛教语。顿悟。
(23)佛教语。顿教的省称。
(24)书法和绘画的技法之一。
(25)指句子中按语气应稍稍停顿的地方。
(26)指诗歌的音组。
(27)顿时，立刻。
(28)同时；一下子。
(29)全；全部。
(30)绝然。
(31)量词。次数。一次称一顿（用于饭食）。

頓字的康熙字典解释

【戌集下】【頁字部】　頓； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页1401第11
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?都困切，敦去聲。【說文】下首也。【周禮·春官·大祝】辨九?，二曰頓首。【註】頓首，拜頭叩地也。　又【博雅】頓，僵也。　又【揚子·方言】頓愍，惛也。江湘之閒謂之頓愍。南楚飮毒藥懣亦謂之頓愍，猶中齊言眠眩也。　又【增韻】貯也，宿食所也。【隋書·煬帝紀】每之一所，輒數道置頓。　又【增韻】次也。又食一次也。【世說新語】襄陽羅友，嘗伺人祠乞食。往太蚤，主人問何得在此。答曰：聞卿祠，欲乞一頓食耳。【杜甫詩】頓頓食黃魚。　又陡頓，遽也。【列子·天瑞篇】一氣不頓盡，一形不頓虧。　又壞也。【左傳·襄四年】甲兵不頓。【註】頓，壞也。正義曰：頓，謂挫傷折壞，今俗語委頓是也。　又止也。【史記·王翦傳】三日三夜不頓舍。　又捨也。【曹植·七啟】頓網縱綱。【註】頓，捨也。縱，緩也。　又地名。【詩·衞風】送子涉淇，至于頓丘。【傳】丘一成爲頓丘。【前漢·地理志】頓丘縣屬東郡。【師古註】以丘名縣也。丘一成爲頓丘，謂一頓而成也。　又國名。【春秋·僖

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［dùn］
Traditional characters of "顿1".
(1) Knock the ground with the first.
(2) Pointing to nodding.
(3) Stomping the ground with one foot.
(4) Touch the ground with an object; drop one object suddenly and collide with another object.
(5) Percussion; percussion.
(6) Pause; fall down.
(7) Go down from a high place.
(8) Destroy; Decline.
(9) Fatigue and fatigue.
(10) Remove; discard.
(11) Dispatch and eliminate.
(12) Jitter; vibration.
(13) To rectify;
(14) Earn; throw away.
(15) Pause, stop.
(16) Accommodation; stationed in the village.
(17) Stay, stay. It is also called stay for a longer period of time.
(18) Accommodation; premises.
(19) Refers to what is needed for lodging.
(20) Placement.
(21) Faint.
(22) Buddhist language. Epiphany.
(23) Buddhist language. The province of Dunjiao.
(24) One of the techniques of calligraphy and painting.
(25) Refers to the place where the tone should be paused in the sentence.
(26) Refers to the sound group of the poem.
(27) Immediately, immediately.
(28) At the same time; all of a sudden.
(29) All; all.
(30) Absolutely.
(31) Quantifiers. frequency. Weigh one meal at a time (for meals).

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
【戌集下】【Page Department】　顿; Kangxi Strokes: 13; Page Number: Page 1401-11
[Tang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] [Zheng Yun]? All sleepy, dumb. [Said the text] The next first also. [Zhou Li·Chun Guan·Big Zhu] Distinguishing the nine?, the second is a pause. [Note] Pause your head and bow to the floor.　[Bo Ya] Pause again, stiff.　[Yangtze Dialect] Suddenly, stunned. Jiang Xiang's leisure is called stunned. The poisonous medicine in the Southern Chu Dynasty is also called a daze.　[Zeng Yun] Storage and accommodation. 【Sui Shu·Yang Di Ji】Each place is set in several places.　 [Zeng Yun] Times also. Eat again. [New Words of the World] Luoyou in Xiangyang, try to beg for food in the temple. Too flea, the owner asked why he was here. The answer is: Wenqing Temple wants to beg for a meal. [Du Fu's poem] Eat yellow croaker all at once.　 Steep again, suddenly. 【Liezi·Tianrui】He never stops in one breath, never loses his sight.　It's also bad. [Zuo Zhuan·Four Years of Xiang] The soldiers did not stop. [Note] Pause, bad too. The justice said: Pause means frustration and setbacks, and this is also true of the common saying.　 Stop it again. [Historical Records·Wang Jian's Biography] Three days and three nights without giving up.　You also give up. [Cao Zhi·Qiqi] Longitudinal Outline of Dayton Net. [Note] Pause, give up. Longitudinal, slow also.　Also place name. 【Poetry·Weifeng】Send the son to Sheqi, as for Dunqiu. [Biography] Qiu Yi became Dun Qiu. [Former Han Geography] Dunqiu County belongs to the East County. [Shigu Note] It is also a county named Qiu. As soon as the mound becomes the mound, it is said that a meal is made.　 Also the name of the country. 【Spring and Autumn·Xi
